result.execSummary:
The defendant Rapheal D Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/15/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

AFTER TWO YEARS, expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.


Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Section 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for City of Brookfield Police Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rapheal D Malone

records.addlTxt:
11:41 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rapheal D Malone in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Rapheal D Malone.  Atty. Gutierrez advises his client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  Court recites the offer as listed on the plea questionnaire.  State and Atty. Gutierrez confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 6, Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gutierrez.


COUNT 6:
The Court Orders the Following:

Court orders the firearm seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 961.555(2m), Wis. Stats. for City of Brookfield Police Dept.

FINE: $379.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/15/2022. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

**After 2 Years, expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:18 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Rapheal D Malone in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he just needs some additional time to review the case before resolving.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a plea and sentencing date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Rapheal D Malone in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is asking for a plea and sentencing date in the next 30 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:18 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Rapheal D Malone in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings date in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.    Defendant to have no contact with co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:33 PM Defendant Rapheal D Malone in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
